the subscription economy in web3

the web3 space is moving away from high-fee models toward something more sustainable: the subscription economy. for a long time, platforms survived by taking a cut of every trade, which often encouraged high-frequency noise and bot activity over

https://t.co/a2j1hYUGQV’s cashback feature. Is it really for traders?

They market it as “rewarding traders” by redirecting creator fees back as cashback on transactions. But realistically, it mainly incentivizes churn.

• No passive rewards for holders — only active buy/sell

YouTube pays creators differently depending on their country. TikTok’s monetization varies by region. Two creators can generate the same number of views and earn completely different payouts purely because of geography. 🌍 

The system reflects advertiser demand, not creative
